commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor: Change app name to Ello
Refactor: Move text constants to AppConstats.java
Utils.java: Add extractTask from String functionality
Refactor: apply custom Exception classes to existing methods
Refactor: Hygeine to create better code modularity
Create TaskCreator functional interface to handle task creation
Refactor task creation logic in CommandParser and TaskParser; introduce TaskType enum for better command handling

commitResults.messageBody: Message describing the changes made in this commit.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor: Add javadoc comments to all relevant classes
commitResults.messageBody:
Current public classes don't have appropriate javadoc comments.

Javadoc comments for public classes and methods are neccessary to comply
with the Java coding conventions.

Let's add javadoc comments to all relevant classes and methods.

Current version doesn't support saving of tasks from previous runs.

Tasks are now parsed into json using Gson into ello.json after each task creation. Tasks are then loaded into TasksList upon initialization.

Let's:
* Create SerializableTask, a serialized version of Task
* Create TasksSaverAndLoader handle saving and loading logic
* Create JsonParser to handle serializing/deserializing logic
* Allow TaskService handle task service during runtime

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor: Add LocalDateTime logic to events
commitResults.messageBody:
Current version treats time as a String.

We want users to input the time in a certain selected formats, and Ello is able to interpret them as LocalDate Time, or throw time-related exceptions otherwise.

Let's:
* Refactor the time fields into LocalDateTime
* Create InvalidDateTimeException and InvalidEventTimeRangeException
* Parse String and validate correct time and date formats using DateTimeParser

There are currently no tests for the command parsers.

Let's add tests for all public methods. Let's also create a Task#equals and Task#hashCode to facilitate better comparison between tasks, assisting the test cases.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Javadoc to the ello.command module
commitResults.messageBody:
Javadoc comments are required for public  classes and methods
within the ello.command module for readability and maintainability.

Let's add javadocs comments to comply with the project's coding
standards.

commitResults.messageTitle: Feature: Add 'find' command to list tasks with exact match
commitResults.messageBody:
Current iteration of Ello does not allow users to filter for tasks.

FindCommand returns tasks containing the exact match as user input.

Let's:
* Implement FindCommand and update TaskList
* Create EmptySearchKeywordException
* Update CommandParser
* Update test cases

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor: Change all project code to follow coding standard
commitResults.messageBody:
It is necessary to change all project code to follow the coding standard
as it is a requirement for the project, and shows profiency and
professionalism in coding.

Let's:
* Change all code to follow the coding standard as specified in the coding
standard guide:
https://se-education.org/guides/conventions/java/intermediate.html

The code in this merge includes changes from the following branches:
* Level-9: Implements the 'find features'
* A-JavaDoc: Adds JavaDoc comments to all classes and methods
* A-Coding-Standard: Refactors code to adhere to coding standards

The merge resolves conflicts to adhere to changes made in the above
branches.

commitResults.messageTitle: Feature: Add basic GUI to Ello
commitResults.messageBody:
The current implementation of Ello is a text-based application.

Creating a custom GUI for Ello will allow users to interact with Ello
in a more intuitive way, and also make Ello more visually appealing.

Let's:
* Add a UI module
* Add a MainWindow controller to display the main window
* Add a DialogBox to display Ello's and users' messages
* Add media resources and FXML files for the UI

The current storage package uses TaskList, which is a model
representation of tasks during Ello's runtime. Hence, it's better to
move it to the model package.

Now, a TaskStorage class is used to handle all interactions between the
runtime and the data file.

SerializableTask, TasksSaverAndLoader and StorageException classes
has also been updated to reflect the changes in the storage package.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor: Rename command to logic and decouple UI from core logic
commitResults.messageBody:
The previous ello.command implementation was tightly coupled with UI
concerns, making the core logic difficult to test and reuse across
different UI classes.

Let's:
* Restructure the project to make command handling indifferent to UI.
* Rename ello.command to ello.logic.
* Update all references to use the new Logic module.
* Allow Logic.java to be the external-facing class interacting
with other components

Since the text CLI has been removed, we can delete the text UI test
files and update the expected output file to reflect the changes in the
application's behavior.

Testing is instead now done through src/test unit tests.

The DateTimeParser#parse method now accept a varargs of DateTimeFormatter for
parsing dates.

This allows potential extensions where non-standard dates can be input into Ello
(e.g: today, 3 days after 1/2) through usage of DateTimeFormatterBuilder.

DialogBox, in future implementations, may follow two styleClasses
(e.g: I want an Ello DialogBox to both have the appearance of an
AddCommand response and an error).

To enable flexibility, DialogBox now accept a varargs of String
representing the different styleClasses that would then be applied
to the target Dialog Box.

commitResults.messageTitle: Extract the style constants to a separate class to improve code organization and maintainability.
Ensure Code Quality in the UI module
commitResults.messageBody:
Code Quality is an important part of software development and CS2103T.
The changes are made in accordance to the following guidelines:
nus-cs2103-ay2526-s2.github.io/website/se-book-adapted/chapters/codeQuality.html

Let's:
* Rename StyleConstants to CssStyleConstants for better clarity.
* Remove UiConstants as it is no longer needed.
* Refactor code in DialogBox, MainWindow, and Ui to enhance readability

Assertions are important for ensuring that the code behaves as expected
and can help catch bugs early in the development process.

In this commit, assertions have been added to the TaskList class to
validate the following:
* The task list is not null when adding a new task.
* The task being added is not null.
* Task deletion makes the task list smaller by one.

Streams can be used to make the code more readable.

TasksSaverAndLoader class has been updated to utilize streams for saving
and loading tasks.

Let's:
* Update load() method to read tasks using streams.
* Update save() method to write tasks using streams.
Add assertions to TaskList
Ensure code quality in the UI module
Add streams to TasksSaverAndLoader

commitResults.messageTitle: Add help command to list available commands.
commitResults.messageBody:
Users can now type "help" to see a list of available commands and their
descriptions. This will make it easier for users to navigate.

Let's:
* Create a new HelpCommand class that implements the Command interface.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refine help command to allow better scalability
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, the help command only prints a hardcoded list of commands
as a string in HelpCommand.java. This approach is not scalable.
As we add more commands, we would require constant revisions to
HelpCommand.java, possibly leading to inconsistencies.

For better maintainability, it is better to refactor the
ui.command package to encapsulate each command's information
within the command itself.

Let's:
* Create a CommandInfo class which encapsulates each command's name,
information, and syntax.
* Update all existing command classes to encapsulate a CommandInfo.
* Refactor HelpCommand to retrieve command information from CommandInfo.
* Update parsers and UI components to use CommandInfo where necessary.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add AI.md to disclose and reflect on AI usage
commitResults.messageBody: The AI.md is a requirement for the CS2103T iP project.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add ElloDialogBox to prompt user to enter 'help'
commitResults.messageBody:
When user is opening the app for the first time, they will be prompted
to enter 'help' to see the list of commands.

This to ensure better usability and to guide new users.

This is done using an ElloDialogBox that appears when the app is
launched.

A README.md file is important for any project as it provides essential
information about the project.

Let's create a README.md file that includes:
* A screenshot of the project
* A description of the project
* Instructions on how to use the project
* Features of the project

The current README.md file is missing the command tables that I think
would be helpful in READMEs.

This commit adds those command tables to provide users with a
comprehensive guide on how to use the various commands available
in the project.

The original text says "Type /help for help". This, however, is not
true. The correct command is "Type 'help' for help".

commitResults.messageTitle: Bug: Fix DateTimeParser valid format descriptions
commitResults.messageBody:
DateTimeParser's method getSupportedFormatsDescriptions returns
inlegible descriptions of the supported formats.

This commit updates the descriptions to be more user-friendly and
informative, making it easier for users to understand the supported
date and time formats.

Let's:
* Encapsulate the date and date-time formats as Strings.
* Uses these Strings to construct DateTimeFormatter objects.
* Uses these Strings to create user-friendly descriptions of the
supported formats.

commitResults.messageTitle: Bug: Fix date time parsing inconsistencies
commitResults.messageBody:
The DateTimeParser had inconsistencies when displaying errors related to
parsing date and time inputs in the UI, as the ElloDialogBox is
immaturely clipped vertically.

Let's:
* Set max height for ElloDialogBox to ensure error messages are clipped
correctly

commitResults.messageTitle: Apply checkstyle to update code formatting
commitResults.messageBody:
Checkstyle is applied to the codebase to ensure consistent code
formatting and adherence to coding standards.

Let's update both main and test files to comply with most of the
checkstyle rules.

Let's:
* Set max height for ElloDialogBox to ensure error messages are clipped

commitResults.messageTitle: Apply checkstyle to update code formatting
commitResults.messageBody:
Checkstyle is applied to the codebase to ensure consistent code
formatting and adherence to coding standards.

Let's update both main and test files to comply with most of the
checkstyle rules.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add test cases to the storage module
commitResults.messageBody:
Testing is crucial to ensure the storage module is able to handle
saving and loading of tasks correctly.

Let's:
* add sample json data for testing
* add test cases for TaskStorage, TasksSaverAndLoader
and SerializableTask

commitResults.messageTitle: Bug: Fix parsing error during loading
commitResults.messageBody:
There is inconsistency in the date time format being loaded into the
data file and the date time format being parsed by the DateTimeParser.
This causes a parsing error during loading, which results in the app not
being able to load the data file.

To fix this issue, we need to ensure that Event and Deadline produces
date time in the format that is being parsed by the DateTimeParser.

Updates to the test cases are also made to reflect the changes.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix checkstyle formatting in test files
commitResults.messageBody:
Checkstyle was conducted on the test files and the formatting issues
were fixed on:
* AddTaskCommandParserTest.java
* SerializableTaskTest.java
* TaskStorageTest.java
* TasksSaverAndLoaderTest.java
